snippet: More than a quarter of children under the age of 5 are permanently “stunted” from malnutrition, the United Nations Children’s Fund said in a report released Monday.
abstract: United Nations Children's Fund releases report finding that more than a quarter of children under age of 5 worldwide are permanently stunted from malnutrition, leaving them physically and intellectually weak.
lead_paragraph: More than a quarter of children under the age of 5 are permanently “stunted” from malnutrition, the United Nations Children’s Fund said in a report released Monday.

headline.seo: Unicef Report Details the Costs Of Malnutrition in Children
headline.main: Unicef Report Details the Costs of Malnutrition in Children
headline.print_headline: Unicef Report Details the Costs Of Malnutrition in Children
